title: Named exports for CJS
body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template because we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->

# Bug report

<!-- Please ask questions on StackOverflow or the webpack Gitter. -->
<!-- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=webpack -->
<!-- https://gitter.im/webpack/webpack -->
<!-- Issues which contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->

**What is the current behavior?**

Named exports for CJS are part of NodeJS LTS 14 and current version 15, and are being [backported to LTS 12](https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/35757), but standard code that runs without issues in NodeJS cannot currently be bundled with webpack due error:

```
Can't import the named export 'XXX' (imported as 'XXX') from default-exporting module (only default export is available)
```


**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**

create an `esm.js` file with this content:
```js
import {log, info} from './cjs/cjs.js';

log('This works');
info('And so does this');
```

put into `package.json` the following content:
```js
{"type": "module"}
```

now create a `./cjs` folder with a `./cjs/cjs.js` file with the following content:
```js
exports.log = console.log;
exports.info = console.info;
```

put into `./cjs/package.json` the following content:
```js
{"type": "commonjs"}
```

Run `node esm.js` and see this outcome:
```
This works
And so does this
```

Now try to configure *webpack* any way to use `./esm.js` as entry point and see this outcome:
```
[webpack-cli] Compilation finished
assets by status 254 bytes [cached] 1 asset
./esm.js 86 bytes [built] [code generated]
./cjs/cjs.js 56 bytes [built] [code generated]

ERROR in ./esm.js 3:0-3
Can't import the named export 'log' (imported as 'log') from default-exporting module (only default export is available)

ERROR in ./esm.js 4:0-4
Can't import the named export 'info' (imported as 'info') from default-exporting module (only default export is available)

webpack 5.3.2 compiled with 2 errors in 155 ms
```

<!-- A great way to do this is to provide your configuration via a GitHub repository -->
<!-- The most helpful is a minimal reproduction with instructions on how to reproduce -->
<!-- Repositories with too many files or large `webpack.config.js` files are not suitable -->
<!-- Please only add small code snippets directly into this issue -->
<!-- https://gist.github.com is a good place for longer code snippets -->
<!-- If your issue is caused by a plugin or loader, please create an issue on the loader/plugin repository instead -->

**What is the expected behavior?**

CommonJS named exports have been available for quite some time, and alternative bundlers seem to be compatible with the current NodeJS standard behavior, but *webpack* is making partial migrations from CJS to ESM a bit harder than it should.

Please consider supporting named exports to make migrations smoother, thank you!


<!-- "It should work" is not a helpful explanation -->
<!-- Explain exactly how it should behave -->

**Other relevant information:**
webpack version:  5.3.2 / CLI 4.1.0
Node.js version: 12, 14, 15
Operating System: Linux / macOS
Additional tools: none
